content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The main target image shows two distinct structures:

1. Left Structure (House-like):
   - 3 layers total
   - Bottom layer: 2 green vertical blocks as pillars
   - Middle layer: 1 yellow horizontal block as a bridge
   - Top layer: 1 red arch block with an orange triangular roof

2. Right Structure (Bridge/Castle-like):
   - 3 layers total
   - Bottom layer: 2 red arch blocks in the middle with 2 green vertical blocks on the sides
   - Middle layer: 3 yellow half-cylinder blocks and 2 yellow vertical blocks
   - No distinct top layer, but the yellow vertical blocks extend upward

Total block count: Approximately 14 blocks across both structures

## Spatial Relationships
- Left Structure: Two green pillars (blocks 3 and 4) support a horizontal yellow block (block 6), topped with a red arch block (block 1) and an orange triangular roof piece (block 15).
- Right Structure: Two red arch blocks (block 1) form a bridge, with two green vertical blocks (block 5) on the outer sides. Above the arches are yellow half-cylinder blocks (block 11 and block 12). Two tall yellow vertical blocks (block 8 and block 9) rise from the back of the structure.

# Selected Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the main target image, the following blocks are needed:

1. Block 1 (Red arch) - Used 3 times (once in left structure, twice in right structure)
2. Block 3 (Green vertical tall) - Used 2 times (as pillars in left structure)
3. Block 5 (Green rectangular) - Used 2 times (as side supports in right structure)
4. Block 6 (Yellow horizontal) - Used 1 time (as bridge in left structure)
5. Block 8 (Yellow vertical tall) - Used 2 times (as towers in right structure)
6. Block 10 (Yellow horizontal) - Used 1 time (in right structure)
7. Block 11 (Yellow half-cylinder) - Used 2 times (on top of arches in right structure)
8. Block 15 (Orange triangular roof) - Used 1 time (as roof in left structure)

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 3
   Step2: Move block with index 3
   Step3: Move block with index 6
   Step4: Move block with index 1
   Step5: Move block with index 15
   Step6: Move block with index 5
   Step7: Move block with index 1
   Step8: Move block with index 1
   Step9: Move block with index 5
   Step10: Move block with index 8
   Step11: Move block with index 10
   Step12: Move block with index 8
   Step13: Move block with index 11
   Step14: Move block with index 11
}
```

The assembly follows a bottom-up approach for each structure, starting with the left house-like structure before moving to the right bridge/castle-like structure.
